cluster_relations.rel_desc: Duplex stainless steel is one of the four categories of stainless steels listed.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject material class has the object as a more specific subtype or category within it.
remarks: Although text just says 'duplex', entity is resolved as duplex stainless steel; relation captures the category membership.
Although text just says 'duplex', entity is resolved as duplex stainless steel; relation captures the category membership.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Duplex stainless steel is a subtype/category within the broader class of stainless steels.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific subtype or category within the broader class represented by the object.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a more specific subtype or category within the broader class represented by the object.
args.justification: This relation is the inverse of RelR_39cf0ff7f895 and expresses the same taxonomic hierarchy. To maintain schema consistency, hierarchical material-category links should use a single canonical predicate 'is_subtype_of' with a shared description, regardless of direction in raw relation_name. The existing rel_cls and rel_cls_group are already appropriate for a taxonomic identity/hierarchy relation.
args.remark: Normalized hierarchical material category relation to use the same canonical predicate 'is_subtype_of' as the inverse instance in this cluster.
